programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A famous monster washes up on a New York beach, parents catch ghosts haunting nurseries on baby monitors and a UFO saves a Russian town.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Dog and David go to Las Vegas to hunt down Jamie Jungers, one of Tiger Woods' alleged mistresses. Can they find Jamie and send her to Kansas to stand trial?.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: A lack of food takes a toll on the remaining participants. Many have not eaten in days and it is beginning to impair their mental and physical capabilities.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Marty fights for every last dollar as his season goes into freefall, Eustace and Preston experiment in barnyard engineering and Jason gets locked out of a new home.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: An early thaw puts Morgan's supply drop on thin ice, Marty hunts the beasts of Kodiak Island and Tom makes the most of his unprecedented winning streak.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron challenges his protege Leonard to a big rig contest, and the crew works on a rare 1950s British motorcycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Funk singer George Clinton challenges Rick and the team to return a 1920s grand piano to its former glory.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features Jo Brand, Joan Rivers, Aisling Bea, Kerry Godliman, Nina Conti, Luisa Omielan, Gina Yashere, Angela Barnes, Zoe Lyons, Holly Walsh, Desiree Burch and Tanyalee Davis.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Carl Donnelly, Jo Caulfield and Milton Jones join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from June 2012.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe and Miles Jupp join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a July 2012 edition of the comedy panel show taking a look back at the week's news.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Carol Vorderman, Larry Lamb, Jo Brand and Russell Howard join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Mangan, David O'Doherty and Suzi Ruffell are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki struggles to come to terms with life back home and seeks out fellow pathologist Sally Vaughan for support, only to learn she is nowhere to be found. National Crime Agency investigator Guy Bernhardt asks Nikki to help him by employing pathologist David Cannon, the chief suspect in Sally's disappearance. As Jack, Clarissa and Thomas share concerns about Nikki's wellbeing, a body found in a reservoir is linked to a murder case from 16 years previously. Return of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, with Julian Rhind-Tutt and Alex Macqueen.

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Emma is forced to rearrange her plans for the festive period at the last minute, leaving Hester and William disappointed they will not get to spend their first Christmas with their grandson. However, it remains to be seen who will help them consume all the extra food and drink they have to hand. Christmas special of the comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Sophy Ridge on Sunday
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news headlines, plus analysis of current affairs issues with leading politicians, a review of stories in the day's national newspapers and weather reports.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the riverside town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue in south-eastern France, where his culinary hero Keith Floyd once owned a restaurant. Buying produce from its floating market, and a Floyd-style hat, James sets up his mobile kitchen on a bridge overlooking the river, and cooks peaches pain perdu in the sunshine. Heading back in the direction of the town, James samples some truffle-laden dishes at renowned restaurant La Beaugraviere.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Brands Hatch, including the British F4 Championship and the Mini Dunlop Challenge.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Contact Project
programme.desc: While investigating Argentina's most credible military encounter, the team tracks down an eyewitness and the unexpected presence of Nasa.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A team of treasure hunters searches an island somewhere off the south eastern coast of Brazil for millions of dollars' worth of Incan gold.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Teutul Sr visits Europe, where he is inspired to collect vintage two-wheelers. Meanwhile, back at base the staff run into some problems.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A weather-beaten 59 Metro rolls into the shop for an extreme makeover. It's the Flintstones meets the Jetsons - with a surprise twist for its new owner.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The engineering innovations that enable passenger ferry Stena Britannica to simultaneously function as a car carrier, cargo transporter and cruise ship.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How professional ice-hockey players' sticks are manufactured, as well as treadmills and baby shoes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of motorcycles, clay pipes, drumsticks and whistles.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How investigators are devoting time to cracking cartels in a sinister criminal underground spawned by the prevalence of drug trafficking.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Louise Dickey is discovered brutally murdered in a bath of her own blood, police were stumped. However, nearby surveillance cameras may lead to the shocking truth.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: Documentary recalling how in December 2001, Michael Augustson arrived home to a scene of unspeakable horror following the fatal stabbing of his wife Melisa. The pair had only recently moved to Alma, Georgia, where they had soon been accepted by the small-town community.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a young girl abducted on a camping trip - and their investigation is helped by the numerous phone calls the kidnapper makes to the victim's mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Neglected parrots are rescued from an abandoned house, and a trapped cat is helped out of a tight spot. Plus, advice on tackling a wild raccoon.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: I Found the Gown
programme.desc: A bus-load of brides and their entourages from New York descend on Vows in the hope of scoring huge deals on designer wedding gowns.
